title: Rabbit Every Monday/A Mouse Divided/Tree For Two
episode_desc: Bugs introduces many of his co-hosts individually: Pepe Le Pew, Yosemite Sam, Tweety, Sylvester and Speedy Gonzales. But Daffy Duck can't convince Bugs to introduce him as well, try as he might during the show.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Putty Tat Trouble/Wise Quackers/Speedy Gonzales
episode_desc: Rocky and Mugsy try to grab up some of the money from the sponsors of the show by going into the television business themselves, intruding on the proceedings in the process.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Wild Over You/Go Fly a Kit/Mouse-Warming
episode_desc: The midget gangster Baby Faced Finster dresses up as a baby to escape the police. To his dismay, he ends up in the hands of Bugs Bunny, who treats him as a baby.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: To Itch His Own/Gee Whiz-z-z-z!/Whoa, Be-Gone!
episode_desc: Wile E. Coyote's chase of the Road Runner has extended into the studio where Bugs is trying to host his television show. Two Road Runner cartoons are thus featured, involving Wile E.'s schemes.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Canary Row/Knights Must Fall/For Scent-imental Reasons
episode_desc: Desperate to appear on the show as the guest, Daffy dresses as a Hawaiian, a musketeer, and a knight, but his costume is deemed inappropriate by Bugs for each cartoon about to commence.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Long-Haired Hare/Sandy Claws/Mouse Wreckers
episode_desc: In a musical competition between cartoon features of Bugs at war with an opera singer, Sylvester buffeted by tidal waves in his gastronomic quest for Tweety, and two mice conspiring to induce house cat insanity, Daffy plays the drums.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Bully For Bugs/Tweety's S.O.S./One Froggy Evening
episode_desc: Daffy disguises himself as Bugs to host the television show, but a sheepdog, on a day free from his work, walks into the studio, hoping to catch the bunny-rabbit (Bugs) that he saw on television on the previous week.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: My Bunny Lies Over the Sea/Scaredy Cat/Scent-imental Romeo
episode_desc: Daffy wants to be host. So, he banishes all others from the stage, including Pepe, Elmer, and Bugs. Still, the cartoons proceed on schedule, with Bugs in Scotland, Porky and Sylvester in a spooky, mouse-infested house.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Bunker Hill Bunny/Each Dawn I Crow/Golden Yeggs
episode_desc: Tweety is host of an installment containing two psychological thrillers with birds seemingly doomed to death at a specified time. So that the little canary can be safe from Sylvester, Bugs hangs his cage from the stage ceiling.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Which is Witch/Mouse Mazurka/Kit For Cat
episode_desc: Yosemite Sam wants Bugs' hide. So, gun in hand, he comes to see The Bugs Bunny Show live as a spectator in the studio.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Two's a Crowd/All a Bir-r-r-d/The Hasty Hare
episode_desc: Bugs introduces Porky Pig as host. Porky is pestered by Charlie Dog, who is looking for a master. Charlie does his all-breeds-in-one routine and complicates Porky's introduction.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: What's Up, Doc?/Early to Bet/Pop 'im Pop!
episode_desc: George P. Dog is introduced by Bugs as the emcee for the show, but Foghorn Leghorn decides that he would be a better emcee and pushes the dog aside.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: A-Lad-in His Lamp/Dog Gone South/A Fractured Leghorn
episode_desc: Sylvester is introduced by Bugs as host, and he is joined on stage by his son, Sylvester Jr., who is underwhelmed at Sylvester's all-too-brief introduction of him.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Ant Pasted/The Fair-Haired Hare/I Gopher You
episode_desc: Elmer Fudd is host and tries to sing, but he is thwarted when the notes on his sheet music run off of their page and remind him of his July 4 picnic that became a harrowing confrontation.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Rocket Squad/Daffy Dilly/Drip-Along Daffy
episode_desc: Daffy finally receives recognition. Bugs hosts an all-Daffy Duck tribute, in which Mama Bear performs "I'm Just Wild About Daffy" and the mallard stars in cartoons as a far-future detective.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: The Leghorn Blows at Midnight/His Bitter Half/Hot Cross Bunny
episode_desc: Foghorn Leghorn introduces Miss Prissy, who, Foghorn says, is an old-time actress.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Lovelorn Leghorn/Who's Kitten Who?/The Windblown Hare
episode_desc: An unseen animator sketches Foghorn Leghorn with Rock Hudson's body and then draws a broom's tail on Foghorn's backside. Foghorn retaliates by lassoing and pummeling the animator- Daffy Duck.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: High Diving Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge For a Mouse
episode_desc: Two lame-brained Mexicali cats, Jose and Miguel, try to host an episode with Yosemite Sam plummeting again and again into a bucket of water, Ralph Wolf being continually stopped from obtaining mutton by the omnipresent Sam Sheepdog.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: High Diving Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge For a Mouse
episode_desc: Bugs demonstrates how to draw an animated cartoon character. He decides to use Daffy Duck as an example and draws Daffy from a dumbbell.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Rabbit of Seville/The Scarlet Pumpernickel/Stop! Look! And Hasten!
episode_desc: Bugs tries to indulge the audience in a bit of culture, such as in his own rendition of the opera, "The Barber of Seville", in spite of constant interruptions from Elmer Fudd.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Hillbilly Hare/Hippety Hopper/You Were Never Duckier
episode_desc: Mac and Tosh, the Goofy Gophers, are introduced by Bugs as the host. In the cartoons, Bugs orchestrates a square dance that very much pains two lame-brained men of the Ozark Mountains.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: The Turn-Tale Wolf/Paying the Piper/Beanstalk Bunny
episode_desc: Sylvester is host and tells to his son, Junior, the Looney Tune-style fairy tales of the Big Bad Wolf and the Three Little Pigs- in which hero and villain roles are seemingly reversed.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Big House Bunny/Canned Feud/Home, Tweet Home
episode_desc: Mac and Tosh, the Goofy Gophers, are again hosts for the show. They spend their time politely arguing over who should introduce the jailed Bugs, house-imprisoned and in-need-of-food Sylvester, and Tweety-in-a-city-park.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Mississippi Hare/Terrier-Stricken/Cheese Chasers
episode_desc: Yosemite Sam wants to be the show emcee this time around, but Bugs chooses Pepe Le Pew instead, much to Sam's chagrin.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Henhouse Henery/Curtain Razor/Devil May Hare
episode_desc: Bugs introduces Daffy Duck as this installment's host, but Daffy is backstage being chased by the Tasmanian Devil, who has broken out of a crate.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Hare We Go/The Foghorn Leghorn/Little Red Rodent Hood
episode_desc: Okay, rabbit. Grab a cloud. This is a stick-up." Gun-toting gangsters Rocky and Mugsy hijack the show. Mugsy escorts Bugs off of the stage, and Rocky introduces the cartoons.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Bad-Time Story
episode_desc: It is "Reading Out Loud Night", and Bugs selects a book from a shelf and walks into a backdrop leading into the first cartoon feature for this fairy tales and legends installment.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Satan's Waitin'
episode_desc: Yosemite Sam dies after being crushed by a falling safe during his evil scheme to divest a widow of her money and he goes to hell, where the devil promises to release Sam's spirit, provided that Sam bring to the devil a certain rabbit.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Daffy Doodling
episode_desc: Daffy outwits Bugs for the position of emcee, Sylvester and a brawny, stupid sidekick hunt mice in a warehouse, the Goofy Gophers find that their lumber-harvested home tree has been converted into human furniture.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Omni-Puss
episode_desc: Bugs Bunny lectures about cats, describing with visual aid an alley cat, a Bob Cat greeting a Tom Cat, a pole cat, two Persian cats making a Persian-to-Persian telephone call, etc..
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Tired and Feathered
episode_desc: Bugs Bunny gives a lecture on birds.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Man's Best Friend
episode_desc: Bugs Bunny lectures about dogs, but first must struggle with a projectionist who, when Bugs says that the lecture is about man's best friend, shows a picture of a tarantula and then a Whistler's Mother portrait.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Ball Point Puns
episode_desc: Red and black dancing pens, named Penelope and Penbroke, perform like figure skaters on paper provided by Bugs.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: The Unfinished Symphony
episode_desc: Bugs contends with an annoying fly in this musical show, featuring a mouse who can play a miniature piano, Bugs' conducting of an orchestra's performance of "Morning, Noon, and Night in Vienna" by Franz Von Suppe.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Prison to Prison
episode_desc: Bugs, dressed like the portly Alfred Hitchcock, lectures on crime.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Go Man Go
episode_desc: The subject for tonight's show is one that has always puzzled us little denizens of the woodland glades." In yet another lecture, Bugs talks about man.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: I'm Just Wild About Hare
episode_desc: Bugs has overslept. When the announcer summons him by hole-shaped elevator to the stage, either he is in his bathrobe, barely awake and brushing his teeth, or he is drying himself after a shower, or he is occupied with his vacuum cleaner.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Stage Couch
episode_desc: Sylvester needs psychiatric help when his frustration at being unable to catch Tweety has him on the verge of mental collapse.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Do or Diet
episode_desc: The Tasmanian Devil is Bugs' guest on this episode, in which the rabbit prescribes a carrot diet to the beast.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Hare Brush
episode_desc: Introduced by Bugs, Harry the Brush explains his role in the animation of cartoons wherein Claude Cat schemes to implicate bulldog Marc Antony.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Is This a Life?
episode_desc: In this spoof of This is Your Life, Bugs Bunny's life is reviewed, with visits from friends and foes.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: De-Duck-Tive Story
episode_desc: Daffy recounts many of his detective escapades.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: The Astro-Nuts
episode_desc: Bugs Bunny emerges from his hole on stage as Super-Rabbit, defender of the defenseless, buddy of the buddy-less, to introduce science fiction cartoons.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Vera's Cruise
episode_desc: Sylvester recounts his recent travels through Europe, when his pursuit of Tweety became transoceanic and transcontinental.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Foreign Legion Leghorn
episode_desc: Foghorn Leghorn's farmyard life has been so tough on him that he decides to enlist in the French Foreign Legion.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Watch My Line
episode_desc: The art of cartoon drawing is demonstrated by an animator, whom Bugs instructs to draw a line, which turns into different things.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: What's Up Dog?
episode_desc: A second look at dogs, hosted by Bugs.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: The Cat's Bah
episode_desc: Pepe Le Pew recalls the results of broken romances in Africa. He suggests that viewers "take a brief respite from romance" by joining Bugs Bunny, whose Miami Beach vacation went afoul.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: No Business Like Slow Business
episode_desc: Slowpoke Rodriguez and Speedy Gonzales are co-hosts, introducing cartoons in which Sylvester and the Big Bad Wolf team to stalk Tweety and Little Red Riding Hood in the house of Granny.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: The Honeymousers
episode_desc: A great spoof of the 1950's TV show, "The Honeymooners", starring Daws Butler as the voices of both the "Ralph Kramden" and "Ed Norton" characters, and June Foray as both "Alice Kramden" and "Trixie Norton"
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: A Star Is Bored
episode_desc: Bugs provides yet another lecture on cartoon animation, secretly stating that he does the voice of Mel Blanc. Daffy, meanwhile, tries to upstage the rabbit in the guise of a clean-up artist from a cartoon agency.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: A Tale of Two Kitties
episode_desc: Sylvester and son discuss mice, ranging from those from Mexico to those of the "giant" variety.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Terrier-Stricken/Dog Gone South/Devil May Hare
episode_desc: Bugs introduces Porky Pig as the host for the show. Porky is pestered by Charlie Dog, who is looking for a master.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: The Windblown Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge for a Mouse
episode_desc: After starring in a cartoon as the temporary straw-and-wood-house-buying dupe of Three wolf-wary and dishonest Little Pigs, Bugs lectures about dogs, but first must struggle with a projectionist.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Barbary-Coast Bunny/Henhouse Henery/Canned Feud
episode_desc: Bugs Bunny introduces the host for this show, Pepe Le Pew, who is in an apartment in Paris.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

title: Hare We Go/A Waggily Tale/Just Plane Beep
episode_desc: Wile E. Coyote's chase of the Road Runner has extended into the studio where Bugs is trying to host his television show.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.

episode_desc: Desperate to appear on the show as the feature performer, Daffy dresses as a Hawaiian, a musketeer, and a knight, but his costume is deemed inappropriate by Bugs for each cartoon about to commence.
show_desc: TV series featuring the classic Looney Tunes animated shorts.
